Question: This person's son by Caesar, Caesarion, was proclaimed pharaoh by the Egyptians, after Alexandria fell to Octavian.
Hints: This person had also executed her strategos of Cyprus, Serapion, who had supported Cassius against her wishes.
This person was also given the title of "Queen of Kings" by Antonius.
The high degree of inbreeding amongst the Ptolemies is also evident when one considers this person's immediate family.
